tool.name: OGS: MeshMapping
tool.description: Galaxy wrapper for the OGS utility 'MeshMapping'.
tool.command: if [ "$mesh" != "None" ] && [ ! -e '${$mesh.element_identifier}' ]; then ln -s '$mesh' '${$mesh.element_identifier}'; fi; if [ "$raster" != "None" ] && [ ! -e '${$raster.element_identifier}' ]; then ln -s '$raster' '${$raster.element_identifier}'; fi; if [ "$input" != "None" ] && [ ! -e '${$input.element_identifier}' ]; then ln -s '$input' '${$input.element_identifier}'; fi; MeshMapping $lowpass #if str($static).strip() != 'None' and str($static).strip() != '': --static '$static' #end if #if str($distance).strip() != 'None' and str($distance).strip() != '': --distance '$distance' #end if #if str($mesh).strip() != 'None' and str($mesh).strip() != '': --mesh '$mesh.element_identifier' #end if #if str($raster).strip() != 'None' and str($raster).strip() != '': --raster '$raster.element_identifier' #end if --input '$input.element_identifier' --output output_1.vtu

param.name: lowpass
param.label: lowpass
param.help: Applies a lowpass filter to elevation over connected nodes.

param.name: static
param.label: static
param.help: Static elevation to map the input file to. This can be combined with mapping based on rasters or other meshes to deal with locations where no corresponding data exists.

param.name: distance
param.label: distance
param.help: Maximum distance to search for mesh nodes if there is no corresponding data for input mesh nodes on the mesh it should be mapped on. (min = 0)

param.name: mesh
param.label: mesh
param.help: Input (.vtu). 2D mesh file to map the input file on

param.name: raster
param.label: raster
param.help: Input (.asc | .grd | .xyz) Raster file to map the input file on

tool.help: This tool runs the **MeshMapping** utility from the OpenGeoSys suite.
